request.description:
This requests checks if you have already initiated analysis request for the same GSTIN. It is a good idea to check this before initiating a fresh new request.

It will return 200 OK if GSTIN already exists in the system. You can then get on with rest of workflow like OTP auth flow, requesting analysis etc.

If GSTIN does not exist, it will return a 404. Isn't that cool? Well maybe not!

response.name: Check if GSTIN analysis exists

item.name: Create new GSTIN for analysis with file as source

request.description:
This requests creates a new GSTIN for analysis in the system. Creating a new GSTIN does not actually kick-off the analysis. You will have to initiate analysis separately after auth flow.

Note that this step does not need OTP or other credentials for the GST portal. Those parameters are part of a separate API flow (OTP validation). Make sure you are putting GSTIN of the parties you know (like your customers) who have consented to doing this.

request.description: This requests creates a deletes a GSTIN and all the related analysis for that GSTIN from xambit system. Be careful! All data and analysis for that GSTIN will be lost and not recoverable. However, you can re-trigger the analysis request for that GSTIN using other API endpoints. Remember that those API requests cost $$ 😊, so don't delete analysis unless you know why!

item.name: Get public data for this GSTIN

request.description:
This request fetches only public data for a (valid) GSTIN number. No collection/loan application entry will be created in the backend. NOTE the ?public=true query parameter. Also, you may incur xAmbit API usage costs since public data fetch is not a free API.

The API response structure is same as getting data for an analyzed GSTIN, but all fields related to metrics/tax payments etc are empty.

response.name: Check if GSTIN analysis exists

item.name: Start OTP Auth Flow for a GSTIN

request.description:
This requests starts the OTP based auth flow for a particular GSTIN. Make sure that you have already created the GSTIN in the system using POST API documented earlier. The workflow is: you'd request OTP by first calling this endpoint and then share the OTP with xAmbit's machines by making call to {{this endpoint}}/valid endpoint once OTP is received (documented next in this collection).  
  
Make sure you've are initiating this on behalf of your customer who has consented for this. You'll need to know their GSTIN portal user name. They'll receive an OTP on official mobile number for consent.  
  
Don't do this on using random GSTINs from public information etc.

request.description:
This is the main endpoint!  
  
This requests creates a new GSTIN basic analysis request. The basic part means that information primarily from GSTR3B will be used to derive the metrics.

This request can be initiated only after you have created the GSTIN in the system and then completed auth flow via OTP. The parameters to be sent are

item.name: Add 3B file to existing collection as multi part form

formdata.description: Whether to run aggregation to calculate metrics (should set to true)
Whether to use xAmbit AI to generate summary report
URL to which xAmbit should send reponse
Some parameters like credentials for webhook URL where xAmbit will post the results

request.description: Add a GSTR3B return file to an existing GSTIN (collection). Data will be extracted from file. Note that file is added as a multi-part form data under `file`

item.name: Add 3B file to existing collection with json data

request.description: Add a GSTR3B return file to an existing GSTIN (collection). Data will be extracted from file. Note that file content is added as an array of u8 in the request body.

item.name: Bank Statement Analyser

request.description:
Create new analysis for bank statement. This creates a collection and returns you a collection ID. You should save this collection ID (example: in a database). Further analysis and retrieval happens against the collection ID.

- aggregate: bool, whether data in transactions should be aggregated to derive metrics. This should be set to true.
- infer: bool, whether to use xAmbit LLM to do an analysis of the metrics.
- name: string, an optional string name given to this analysis.
- hook: after analysis is complete, xAmbit will send the response to the URL endpoint specified in hook object, after setting headers specified in the hook object using the method specific in the hook object.

item.name: Upload file to existing collection for analysis as multi part form

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

request.description:
Add a file to an existing collection for bank statement analysis. This request returns 200 OK if everything is found in order.

The parameters in the header are documented below.

- file: multipart form data which contains actual content of the file to be analysed.

item.name: Upload file to existing collection for analysis with json data

request.description:
Add a file to existing collection for bank statement analysis by adding one single file for analysis. This request returns 200 OK if everything is found in order.

The parameters in the body are documented below.

- file: is an object with keys `blob`, `category` and `name`
    
- name: string, a name assigned to the file
    
- category: int, should be set to 5(i32) indicating bank statement
    
- blob: array of u8s representing the actual content of the file.

item.name: Get data for already analysed collection

request.description: THIS API IS NOT YET IMPLEMENTED. It is a work in progress!

item.description: Detailed documentation can be found on xambit portal.
